text:
Better presolve. Better simplex. Better cuts. Better heuristics. Better branching strategies.
:D

Better presolve. Better simplex. Better cuts. Better heuristics. Better branching strategies.
:D

text: Incremental progress by 10% every few months

yeah, when I first approached this my thinking was, "well if we break this down into pieces, and just think about a bare simplex with no pre-solve, no integer constraints, nothing, how the hell can you be faster by so much?"  But that's the point, you can't, it's that solving a MILP has so many steps and there are so many places to find clever things to do.  If you could really just run the bare LP, it's probably only like 20% faster or something
